Articles.Content:
I quit a session and launched the game a couple of hours later.

I didn't change anything, no mod updates, no settings.

Inside career I have kinda orbital decay (low polar orbit) and the overall fps is lower (SPC, VAB, flight mode, everywhere).

There is no log spamming at all (30 seconds no single line written).

Anybody has a clue by experience?

Is orbital decay a "feature" on polar orbits or something like that?

Could it come from any mod update of the last few days?

Logs:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/8af8oe54uye7tc4/2017-07-22-1 KSP.log.zip?dl=1

On 7/22/2017 at 2:41 PM, Gordon Dry said:

I quit a session and launched the game a couple of hours later.

I didn't change anything, no mod updates, no settings.

Inside career I have kinda orbital decay (low polar orbit) and the overall fps is lower (SPC, VAB, flight mode, everywhere).

There is no log spamming at all (30 seconds no single line written).

Anybody has a clue by experience?

Is orbital decay a "feature" on polar orbits or something like that?

Could it come from any mod update of the last few days?

Logs:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/8af8oe54uye7tc4/2017-07-22-1 KSP.log.zip?dl=1

I've been noticing slow orbital decay when I am sub orbital but out of the atmosphere. Once ive circularized it seems to be fine. Not sure if this is related

Could be a code quirk.

Either it should be off or on, but not half-wise.

On 22.7.2017 at 11:41 PM, Gordon Dry said:

Could it come from any mod update of the last few days?

Could be the problem with the losless physics setting in Better Time Warp:

I don't think so, this is my settings.cfg: 

// BetterTimeWarp: Automatically saved at date 7/27/2017 5:03:17 AM

enabled = true
BetterTimeWarp
{
	ScaleCameraSpeed = True
	UseLosslessPhysics = False
	LosslessUpperThreshold = 4
	CurrentTimeWarp = Standard Warp
	CurrentPhysWarp = Standard Physics Warp
	CustomWarpRate
	{
		name = Hyper Warp
		warpRate1 = 10
		warpRate2 = 100
		warpRate3 = 1,000
		warpRate4 = 10,000
		warpRate5 = 100,000
		warpRate6 = 1,000,000
		warpRate7 = 10,000,000
		physics = False
	}
	CustomWarpRate
	{
		name = Slow-Mo
		warpRate1 = 0.50
		warpRate2 = 0.25
		warpRate3 = 0.10
		physics = True
	}
	CustomWarpRate
	{
		name = Unity sucks
		warpRate1 = 10
		warpRate2 = 50
		warpRate3 = 100
		warpRate4 = 250
		warpRate5 = 1,000
		warpRate6 = 10,000
		warpRate7 = 100,000
		physics = False
	}
}

The last profile is the standard profile.
